benchmark_details.name: CovidTracker: A comprehensive Covid-related social media dataset for NLP tasks
benchmark_details.overview: We present a benchmark database of public social media postings from the United Kingdom related to the Covid-19 pandemic for academic research purposes.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To understand public sentiment around the pandemic and help inform public health professionals' decisions.

data.source: Collected messages from Twitter and Facebook using their APIs.
data.annotation: Keyword frequency analysis based on a previously established topic taxonomy.

methodology.calculation: Indicators of topic prevalence determined by keyword analysis.
methodology.interpretation: Analysis of messages is performed to gauge the mood and response of users during Covid-19.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Conducted assessment of privacy risks and complied with GDPR.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.data_licensing: Released for public access under academic research purposes.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.compliance_with_regulations: Complied with GDPR and relevant network policies.
